page.title: 08St.Nicholas Church,Hereford.
page.content: St.Nicholas Church is 145 years old. The original building (mentioned in Domesday) was in King St.and was taken down to widen the road.The oldest things in the church are a little{bell which is 600 years old and a{round {window}from the original church. The{altar}is made of old English oak. On each side of the altar are murals of the{Ten Commandments,}the {Lord's Prayer}and the{Creed.}By the {font,}which was made in 1865,is a candle representing the Light of Jesus. The{lectern}is shaped like an eagle to fly carrying God's Word. The {organ}case is 30 years old and the pipes outside are dummies. The inside is 100 years old and there are about 1000 pipes.There are 15 people in the choir. Three{stained glass windows show St.John,St. Luke and Jesus going up to Heaven.
